Activity – Access Methods

Select the most appropriate access method for each scenario.
1. <textformat blockindent='13'>You are in the equipment room with a new switch that needs to be configured.</textformat>
2. <textformat blockindent='13'>The device you are configuring cannot be accessed by cable, because you are not in the building. You use a telephone to dial into it.</textformat>
3. <textformat blockindent='13'>Your manager gives you a special cable and tells you to use it to configure the switch.</textformat>
4. <textformat blockindent='13'>You access the IOS by using another intermediary device over a network connection.</textformat>
5. <textformat blockindent='13'>You are on vacation and need to check on one of your routers. The only access you have is your hotel analog phone.</textformat>
6. <textformat blockindent='13'>You do not need remote access services to the networking device to configure it because the device is physically accessible to you.</textformat>

7. <textformat blockindent='13'>You call your manager to tell him you cannot access your router in another city over the Internet. He provides you with the information to access the switch through a telephone connection.</textformat>
8. <textformat blockindent='13'>The password for a device was changed. No one knows what the new password is and you need to reset a new password.</textformat>
9. <textformat blockindent='13'>You use a password-encrypted connection to remotely access a device over a network.</textformat>
You successfully matched the most appropriate access method to each scenario.
You have not successfully matched most appropriate access method to each scenario. Please click Reset to try again.
